text: On tap @ Rogue SF. Pours clear dark golden with thin creamy off-white head that laces well. Aroma is light sweet pils malt, with a slight corn note throughout. Dry, floral hops on the back. Taste is a big sweet light-bodied malt, boozy and thick. Same floral hops, though they really get overwhelmed by the hefty malt bill. Lingers slightly bitter on the finish. Pretty good as imperial pilsners go.

Bottle with Sune and Theis. Hazy golden, medium sized nicely lacing white head. Effervescent. Grain, green plants, dry flowers, booze. Full body, some sweetness, heavy bitter, dry. Ok, but fairly boozy and bitter.

Bottle from Mads in Sommerhuset. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Quite sweet with a medium bitterness. Aromas of sprucey hops with notes of soap and alcohol. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Bitter finish.
Tap. Orange, cloudy, rocky head, tan foam, medium bitterness, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, & long finish.

One strange brew, this pours a cloudy, headless murky pale gold. Aroma is nice and malty with a sweetness and some floral hop. Flavor is initial malt and some honey up front (nice), but quickly hits with a bitter/astringent bite mid-sip that lasts through the finish and leaves the throat dry.

Swing-top bottle, Ale House, Chelmsford, SX Bottle Share, 1st December 2015 

White lacing. Golden semi-hazy appearance. Aroma is huge spices, some grain, musty sweaty socks. Taste is spices, sweet caramel, malty body, oxidation. Ok but not amazing,

Hazy golden amber pour with small off white head. Aroma of malts, hops, caramel, slightly floral and grains. Taste of malts, hops, slight caramel, grains and slight citrus. Full bodied, lower carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, crisp hop finish. A little boozy up front but a delicious beer!
From a 22 oz bottle at home. Pours a hazy gold with an off white head. Floral nose. Flavors of tropical fruit, hibiscus, and caramel malt. Big, boozy finish.
Draft. Pours a light golden color. Aroma and taste are very hoppy and bitter.
Pours a hazy yellow color with a soapy white head. Notes of honey, clover, skunky hops, and some cereal grains. Medium weight mouthfeel with a long, sweet finish.

Its hard to rate this beer a 9 or 10 overall, based on pilsners not having much aroma and appearance. With that said, this is probably a very high 8....say an 8.8. One of the most crisp beers that Ive had. Seems pretty light, but has a nice alcohol content and will fill you up. You can really taste the malt in this one. Has a pale yellow appearance, with a very light white head. I try not to spend this kind of money too often for high priced beers, but this is worth the price....well, almost. A luxury beer for sure.

Look, I'm all about ales, lager just ain't my thing. That might be why this is getting a higher rating than usual, I will admit. 

Hoppy and thick through the nose; a clean, yet golden haze on sight. The head was thick initially but faded too quickly (bottle poured), yet whilst there it held a lovely citrus, hinting on something sweet, like a light caramel. The palate carried those hops through and this is where the malt character drove its way home. "Hedonistic"** is how those Rogues described it, but the malt had a tingle and bite that draws away from the pleasure (hey, don't get me wrong, I love a tough IBU to chew through), but it had interest and tang and a freshness that made this "Aleman" turn his head and say "hot damn". It still had a lot of lager essentials (that Yeastie flavour, that bites and kicks back, but it just turned its nose to all the bad, and gave a good nod to what I hope is a new world of the lighter, simpler style).

Best Lager I've had, by far. How "true to form" it is... I can't say. But if you're of my opinion, and steer clear of Lagers, find this. Thank the Rogue guys later. 

**Hedonism: maximization of pleasure over pain.

Aroma is clove, honey, yeast, and light caramel. Taste is a somewhat rich roasty malt body met with a fairly deep hop profile. Appearance is a clear gold/orange with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

On tap at Brothers Beer Bistro (Ottawa, ON). Beautiful, slightly hazy, orange body with a thin white foamy head. Nice malty/hoppy aroma with fruity (orange, mango) hints. Its robust hoppy taste carries malty, woody, and citrusy notes. Ends with a long, sharp, bitter finish. Good stuff.
Aromas of bread crust, booze, doughy, some grassy hops. Hazy straw-golden with a mostly fading white head. Dry, strong. Full bodied.

En fût au Brothers. Blond doré légèrement voilé. Fine mousse blanche. Belle effervescence. Malté. Sucré. Bonne amertume. Légèrement épicé. Poivré. Florale. Herbacé. Fine chaleur d'alcool. Bien équilibré. Finale sèche. Très bien.

On tap @ Elfos Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with a hazy golden colour, small long lasting rocky white head. Aroma is medium to heavy malty, with notes of bread, and medium to heavy hoppy, with notes of resin and grass. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.

Pours hazy gold colour with good fluffy head. Sweet honey like nose. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation. Sweet malt flavour and big bitterness following through that lingers. Not bad but not sure Id get another
on tap at Morimoto in Philadelphia; gold color; light, floral hop aroma; smooth, light malt with bitter, floral hops and citrus notes; dry, bitter finish

Shared with Yuriko. Sweet almost honey perfumy nose with a big dose of floral hops for some balance. But it just doesnt meld all that well. Its like a super sweet syrupy beer immediately followed by an uber hoppy earthy bitterness, rather than a sweet and hoppy balance. Good for what it is I guess. But definitely not a style that Im seeking out. The bottle itself is the biggest selling feature.

Appearance: slightly hazy yellow. Bubbly. Big white airy head that lasts awhile.

Aroma: fruitty ethers, fresh rain. Slight woodyness, but light.

Taste: crisp, grapefruit, lemon, some pine-like earthyness. A little tart with a bite at the end, 

Feel: Very crisp and lively. Excellent with dinner (pulled pork). 

Excellent beer. Bottle is also awesome. Wing top stopper allows me to save some for a glass tomorrow. Hail Rogue and the Iron Chef for another job well done.
"maltier than expected, but still heavy on the hops and bitterness. Not worth the price ($12) as Sam Adams IP is better. This one didnt taste fresh. OK."

750ml bottle.Very good, a top Pilsner, 8.8% is nice! But..$20 for 750ml is a little bit much!?!?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a lightly murky, light golden with only swirling remnants of a white head. Bouquet is more akin to an APA. Flat, flat, flat. Moonshiny quality. Much like the lid was left of a high gravity pale ale all night sitting on the deck. This is the most awful beer Ive ever drunk. I wouldve been better off with a schlitz.

Bottle (750ml): First I want to say the bottle is very nice, ceramic I think. Pours a most clear golden with a nice white head. This is not your average pilsner, not light , but medium bodied Some fruitiness and malts with a slight bitterness. Nice.

Pours a clear gold, with a nice white head. Aroma of malt, and hops, with a bit of sweetness. Taste is rich and full, a little bitter, with a rich palate. Smooth and drinkable. This one is a bit different than many. Thumbs up!

Pros clear golden with a white head. Tastes as the name suggests, like a pilsener but double. Extra malt and extra sweetness comes through. Moreso than the additional hops. Slightly fruity aroma, malt driven flavour and a crisp finish. Excellent, particularly coming from someone not fond of pilseners

Reviewed from notes.
This was poured into a pilsener.
The appearance was a decent looking hazy orange to light brown color with a nice transparency running about it. It was definitely light enough to see the carbonation rising at a moderate pace. There was a two finger white foamy head that dissipated about a minute and left a nice spider web lacing sticking finely to the sides of the glass.
The smell had a nice typical light spiciness (from an Imperial Pilsener) with a decent bitter to sweet hoppy to malty complexity.
The taste followed the aroma almost exactly and it had a nice spicy to sweet to bitter aftertaste and a dry finish.
On the palate, it sat about a light to medium. Still, it shows just enough sessionability and has a nice carbonation running about it.
Overall, in my opinion, this was a mighty fine Imperial Pilsner well worthy of having again and well worthy of having with its respected food.
Draft at Rogue. Light golden color. Aroma is some grains. Rice. Alcohol. Light bitterness. Average carbonation. Pretty good.

One of those ceramic bottles from notes. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor has floral and fruity hops, mild spices, citrus and tropical notes, pale bready malt, grass. More flavor and character than I would have expected.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden light amber with lasting sudsy head. Aroma is light but intensely hoppy. Corn and malt also present. Flavor is accentuated by aggressive carbonation, but overall thin.
Pours a merkey golden color with a huge white foamy head. Aroma is hoppy. Taste is crisphopps and citrus. Wonderful lacing on the glass.
Not the beer I expected for the price, won't recommend and wont drink again it is not worth the price but had it on the bucket list

Botella de 75 cl lote csnw13 hasta 04-05-2014. del lúpulo, en el momento en 28-04-2014. color rubio traslucido con espuma blanca persistente. Aromas bastante maltosos y de cereales con toques dulces de melocotones y piel de naranja maduros. Cuerpo medio con 8.5 vol bastante intensos y apreciables en todo momento. Paso por boca denso y cremoso, generando bastante espuma al agitar. Sabores también bastante maltosos y de cereales con tonos dulces de frutas maduras con un ligero toque cítrico. Final ligeramente amargo. Bastante buena, imperial pilsner contundente y con sabores intensos.

hazy gold, puffy white head with clumps. Bit of grain and grass in nose, dusty ad crusty with faint metallic. Front is heavy grain, bitterness lightly skunky mid with moderate citrus before jowls burn in the sticky, lightly syrupy corn finish, heavy carbonation helping to suppress that, sugary marshmallow emerging with warmth.
Straw. A pilsner w bite...malty. Im surprised this is almost 9%...I would have guessed half that. On tap at track town.
Tap at Lazy Dog. Light yellow in color with white head. Aroma of malts and grass. Taste of citrus and crisp carbonation.
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours a hazy gold with a layer of cream colored head. Aroma is crisp, light grass/hay. Taste of grapefruit with carbonation.

Poured from tap to glass. Straw hue with nice white head. Aroma is clean, slight hay, spicy hops, ethanol, faint juniper-like undertone. Mouthfeel is nice with medium light body and great carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with a nice easy bitterness in the following and CO2 bite in the finish mixed with ethanol. Overall this is a fantastic pils.
Short-lived sudsy head, cloudy orange-yellow appearance. Light aroma of hops and fruit. Delicious complex flavors, with grapefruit and orange peel among them.
Aroma of flowers and dried fruit, cloudy caramel colour. Complex taste of fruit and grain. Very good palate of malt and dried fruit.

Poured from a bottle. Cloudy orange color, small white foamy head. Sour malt smell. Nice clean fruity and grain flavor with a mild alcohol finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ceramic swingtop 750 ml bottle poured into a footed pilsener glass. Pours a bright, hazy copper with a big, fluffy white head of foam. Pretty good retention. The aroma has notes of candied grapefruit peel and pine. Taste has a thicker pine bitterness that moves to a juicy, lemon citrus sweetness. The alcohol is a touch noticeable toward the finish. Light to medium body. Low to medium carbonation.
what the hell do i need to say? have you tried it ? no well try it its what every pilsner should taste like
Bottle at Craigs tasting. Grassy toffee nose, sweet toffee and caramel, light bitterness.

Bottle at Craigs. Pours golden yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of citurs and floral hops, and straw. Rich mouthfeel, lots going on taste-wise. Finishes clean and crisp. Classic of the style. Very nice.

Citrus fruits on the nose. Malty sweetness the second it gets in your mouth with a lowish carbonation. Hoppy bitterness at the back end with a slight hint of a floral essence. Would not have said that it 8.8%

Dank hefty yellow, little lacey or something else with a white head that flattened quickly. Peppery/spicy lemon peel and straw hop nose - bouquet. Nice, terse maltyness and sweet bitterness throughout. Decent metallic tang, moreish carbonation mouthfeel. Fairly bloody tidy and passable for 8.8%. p>Bottle, Black Friday Tasting, Beer Of Europe
bottle at home ... golden amber ... thin white head ... soft floral dry grassy fruits ... light fizz .. dry hop ... massive grassy hop ... soft toffee ..
8/25/2011. 22 oz. bottle. Pale yellow with a white head. Malty and floral aromas with big hoppy flavors. Hints of citrus. Excellent!

Tap at Rogue Bar SF. Pours a clear yellow with a small white head. Aromas of light citrus, bread malts and floral hops. Taste is more floral hops clinging to the palate. Light bread malts and citrus comes through. This is actually a dangerous beer sitting at 8.8%!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste bready, bitter, floral. I thought this was good. I could drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap: clear straw to gold light white head. Big pale malt lift. Very fresh malt with orange citrus hop edge. Just a hint of resin. Off dry. Moderate to high bitterness and not sour. Very good depth of flavor and length. Malt, grain and fruit. Another coarse beer with loads of flavor and no texture.

FROM NOTES. From a 750ml ceramic swing top bottle into a Spiegelau tulip. 

A: Pale malts, a little bit of fruit and a general, sticky-sweet character. 
A: Poured a nice yellow golden color with good carbonation and a nice white head.
T: Hop forward with malt in the background. Still has a floral citrus taste. Nicely done. 
P: Creamy and full body with moderate carbonation and a touch of oiliness. 
O: The citrus fruits come through beautifully, and the smooth, creamy mouthfeel leaves you refreshed and wanting more!
On tap at fira de la cervesa artesana de Sabadell. Clear golden colour with white head. herbal hops aroma. Malty, sweet taste with herbal hops. Medium body.
Pours slightly hazy and yellowish to amber. Some head. Bready with aroma of fruity hops. Earthy. Medium bodied. I'm not a fan of the style but this was very nice.
Golden in color, clear with a thin head. Nice malt and hops balance Crisp finish this was a very good Pils.

Bottle from the brewery, and from memory. Standard color, head, and aroma, nothing special there. Flavor was malty but not sweet, with just enough hop bitterness to make it enjoyable. Managed to do what most lagers fail to do for me, which is make me want to keep drinking it. Liked it even though it wasnt what I would consider to be great.

Draught at Rhino. Pours a hazy orange-amber with a small diminishing frothy white head. Nice aroma of fruity hops backed by bready malt, light pepper, light alcohol and earthy notes. 
Hoppy flavour but also malty along with pepper, alcohol, earthy notes and a moderate bitter finish. Average to medium bodied. This was surprisingly good and pleasantly hoppy -- good stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color: clear blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell : fruity domination with hops and wheat. Taste: strong bitterness and wheat as bread. Aftertaste: some fruity presence as litchi.

Draft offering..light golden hue..not much from the nose side of things..slightly malty..flavors of honey and slight ginger..shine through on finish..nose has no trace of the fairly high abv but does pack a little punch on the finish to let you know this has some character..
On tap at Brewers on the Bay. Pours a hazy pale yellow with white head that dissipates. Full malt flavor and nice roundedness. Lacked the bitterness i as expecting, with slight floral hop flavor.

Pours gold with a small head.
Nose shows light malt, biscuity notes, spicy and herbal hops.
More aggressive flavours, big spicy and grassy hops along with bready and biscuity malt and an assertive bitterness. No sign of the booze.
Could use a bit more carbonation.
Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt, hops and grass. Taste is light to medium sweet leading to a hoppy and strong finish. Some alcohol noticeable.
Tap. Cloudy pale amber/gold. Slightly sour grassy aroma. Hides its alcohol content dangerously well. A little heavy as a pilsner. Tasty, though.

Hazy amber, pale color with white and fluffy head, always present. Complex aromas and tastes, hoppied but well balanced with a deep malt character.  The overall is great, medium bodied and sometimes intriguing. Amazing likened.

On tap @the Bent Elbow  puts a hazed light gold beer in the glass small cap is tenacious and lasts. Moderate carbonation. Aroma is unique with earthy tones mixing with big bready malts and some (almost) Belgian yeast-like funk, floral hopping. Rich luxurious mouth feel. Verging on heavy bodied but still light enough to have a few. Flavour is dominated by a malty-earthy tone. near the finish you get herbal sharp hopping. Sturdy, satisfying very earthy-musty - one of the most unique beers I have ever tasted

Color ámbar pálido, con espuma blanca de cabeza corta pero duradera. Aromas de cereales, malta y pan. En boca comienza con un sabor maltoso suave y un final amargo ligeramente alcohólico, pero equilibrado. Aunque su textura es ligera y fresca, posee ese punto untuoso propio estas maltas. Muy buena.

750 ml ceramic bottle into lager glass, no bottle dating.  Pours fairly hazy pale golden amber color with a nice 2 finger fluffy white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Dense spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a ton of streaming carbonation retaining the head.  Aromas of big apple, pear, bread, cracker, honey, floral, grass, pepper, pine, herbal, and yeast earthiness.  Very nice aromas with good balance of malt, yeast ester, and hop notes; with good strength.  Taste of pear, apple, bread, cracker, pepper, floral, grass, pine, honey, herbal, and yeast earthiness.  Good amount of floral/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of light fruits, bread, floral, grass, pepper, pine, honey, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice balance of hop, malt, and yeast flavors; with a moderate malt backbone and no cloying flavors after the finish.  High carbonation and medium bodied; with a very crisp, smooth, and moderately prickly mouthfeel that is good.  Alcohol is very well hidden with hardly any warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a damn nice imperial Pilsner style.  All around nice balance of malt, hop, and yeast flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV.  A very enjoyable offering.

.75l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar
Pours hazy yellow with medium to high foamy big bubbled head. Aroma is exotic fruits, pineapple, malts and hops. A bit of alcohol. Flavor is peach, pineapple, hops and malts. Dry and nicely bitter palate. Nice beer.

Bottled. Pours pala golden with a small white  head, that leaves a fair lacing. Aroma of bread, grain along with fruity and grassy notes Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and bitter with alcohol notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft CO2. An OK imperial pils. ★★★
Smell of fruit, amber colour and white head. Fruity, hoppy, some mint also. Flat, or nonexistant carbon. Bitter.

A cloudy, orange beer with a medium and blond head. Aroma of mandarin, lots of fruity sweetness, soem overcooked fruits. Unique and interesting aroma. Taste of mandarin, citrusfruits, lots of bitterness with some sweetness. Medium+ bodied, slightly harsh, balanced carbonation. Very interesting beer with lots of mandarin like sweetness, the unique.

Bouteille céramique 750ml. De couleur  dorée et voilée. Nez de houblon floral, citrique, légèrement herbeux avec des notes résineuses, de pain, de grains de malt pâle, avec des notes dalcool doux et de fruits (agrumes). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement huileuse. Goût de houblon floral, herbeux et légèrement citrique (une amertume qui dure toute la gorgée) avec des notes fruitées (agrumes, traces de mangues) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût malté de pain, léger de miel et de grains sucrés avec en finale une amertume légèrement plus herbeuse et aux faibles notes résineuses ainsi quavec un léger goût alcoolisé. Post-goût moyen et un peu sec, moyennement amer de houblon floral,  herbeux et légèrement citrique.
On tap in Newport. Pale golden with a small white head. Scent is sweet malts, bread and grass. Taste follows.
UPDATED: FEB 15, 2013 Cool bottle. Big malty nose. Cloudy orange color. Grapefruit palate with slight bitter finish

from Erzbierschof - cloudy dark blond beer with no head retention; aroma of grapefruit and candi sugar; full-bodied , sticky and pretty sweet; some grassy bitterness but there are there are the fruity tones which dominate in the finish along with residual sugars and some notes of alcohol

Draught at the Rogue Distillery & Public House, Portland. From notes (March 2010). Some sort of barnyard, heavy mown grass aroma -- which I think is not intended to be there. Bright, clear yellow color. Thick sort of body. Glommy and gloppy. Not the best of this XS series, to be sure.
Pours a golden straw color. Aroma is big malt, crisp, hops. Very nice beer. Not for the price but stills grear brew.

A great surprise.  Pours a nice dark yellow/amber.  Aroma is very floral, with pilsner malts, gentle honey, herbs.  Taste similar - balance is acheived very, very well.  Alcohol hidden.  Very easy to drink, but lots to think about.

pours cloudy golden-orange from a beautiful re-corkable ceramic bottle, smallish head with micro-foamy CO2, stick lacing, a few slow streams. Citrus & honey on the nose. Drinks with a light foamy creaminess up front, 6/10-sweetness, liquid honey, light malts, jasmine, grapefruit/tangerine, transitioning into medium-sharp hops, med-thick-dry hoppy bitterness, finishing lingering hoppy-malty bitter. Medium complexity, med-high depth, good transitions, good drinkability (in a chilled glass). Somewhat heavy but balanced - the alcohol is well-hidden.

Keg @ BrewDog Glasgow. My 1st beer of the year. Orange yellow colour, reasonable head. Sour grassy grain aroma. Big strong flowery corn flavour. Smooth & creamy texture with lingering stron sweet alcohol aftertaste. Dont be put off by the poor aroma.
Poured from bottle warm light orange/straw with light head. Smells of tons of malt, butterscotch, with a bit of candied rind. Tastes of sweet malt and slight hop.

22oz Bottle A - Pours straw/orange hazy wonderfulness, nice white head. S - Intense butterscotch, praline, & carameled malt. T- Definition of a malt bomb! Huge malt spine with mild hop tones, alcohol is hidden well. M - Full, but not heavy body. Good carbonation. O - Malt bombs arent my favorite style, but no denying this is a classic.
Malt bomb, peanut brittle, praline, hopped just enough. Murky opaque yellow. Bitter full mouthful for style. Smooth and big for style.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2013 Keg at BrewDog,Birmingham.
Orange colour with medium head.Malt and citrus aroma but a little cold to detect too much.Sweet and fruity tasting with vanilla coming through after warming a little.Hoppiness there too and certainly the better for letting it stand to take the cold edge off it.Easy drinking and pleasant beer.

Tap at Brewdog Brum. Luminous orange, big froth top. Smells a bit Belgian, or perhaps like an iced Cadillac. Its sweet. Super sweet. Candy, some glazed pineapple. Big squelch in gob. Essence of Pils is just abt detectable in tongue and nose interaction. Nice, but very sweet. Like a hopped Belgian.

Keg, BrewDog Brum, 12/12/12. Murky orange with a flat head. Dried apricot, slightly meaty aroma. Meaty, herbal, Belgian flavour with pepper and vanilla; jellied orange and botanical impressions. Pretty solid.

On tap at Tilt, Oslo. Golden to orange with a white head. Sweet and malty aroma with hops, alcohol and hints of basement. Fairly sweet with a nice, hoppy bitterness in the finish. Bitter and citrussy aftertaste. Fair enough, but I just guess this is not my style of beer, reminds me too much of a strong lager. (2012-12-08)
Bottle from Kaisla, Helsinki. Colour is hazy yellow with small white head. Aromas and flavours are hops, fruits, citrus, yeast and malts. Quite dry.

On tap @ Beer Temple. Blonde color. White, sticky head. Aromas: sweet malts, sweet fruit/apricot. Flavor is medium sweet, alcohol. Medium bodied. Finishes with a medium bitterness. OK, but not great.
Pour hazy, yellow with white head. Aroma is very hoppy, floral and malty. Flavour is grassy, grapefruity and bitter. Someone said German pilsner on steroids. I agree.

21.11.2012. On tap at Schouskjelleren brygghus, Oslo. Golden yellow colour with white head. At first there is a fairly sour aroma. Its rather rich with a good malty body. Strong beer with lots of bitterness and hops. There is a kind of oily mouthfeel. Bitter aftertaste that goes nicely with the strong body and the alcohol..

On tap at Schouskjelleren.
Smooth, honey-like sweetness, very inviting and seducuing. There are hints of the strength, but malt and floral hops blend well.

On tap at Beer Temple. Light hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma is soft, malty sweet, light floral, mostly sweet white bread, grass, like a German Pils on steroids. Flavour is super smooth, malty, white bread, light alcohol, light floral, nice hoppy bitter finish. Medium to fullbodied, slick. Nice.

Medium offwhite shiny head. Hazy yellow body. Fruity floral aroma with strawy bready notes. Dry-sweet resiny caramelly marzipan taste with raisiny bready notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, mealy mouthfeel. Sweet-bitter honey and caramel aftertaste with spicy strawy notes. Lovely! Classic US malt sweetness. (0.25l draft at Schouskjelleren.)

Ceramic bottle 750ml. w. swing top @ The Danish Summer Gathering, TFODRBSG12, Ulfborg.Clear medium yellow colour with a small average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, grass. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light heavy bitter with a long duration, grass, dry, very hoppy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120818]

Impressive but odd. Strong thick malt aroma with some hops presence. Cloudy golden color with very creamy head. Well rounded palate. Bready flavor that covered the alcohol well. There was a finish that was bitter and funky; almost as if this had Brett in it. I wasnt sure this was a hops essence and it was almost distracting. The fact that this was an old bottle may have contributed to the mix of flavors.
Pale yellow with a nice white head. Aroma is mildly grassy with not a small amount of funk. Flavor is a bit sweet, strong slightly grassy malt. Finish is a bit funky and dry.
0,75 l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours hazy golden with a medium head. Aroma is malts with some fruits. Flavor is malts, some fruits and a hoppy finish. Quite nice.

(Bottle, 0.65 l - clay bottle, at Porvoon Kekri, 20121016) The beer poured golden and a little bit hazy. Its head was small and white. Aroma had alcohol, grass and grain. Palate was medium bodied and warming with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, alcohol, grass, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy, boozy and bitter. A too boozy brew with nice malt and hop flavours.

Ceramic bottle. A dark golden beer with a bubbly whipped cream like off-white head. The aroma is sweet malty with a strong hop presence giving it notes of grass, herbs, and citrus. The flavor is sweet malty at first, but very soon first the hops hits the tongue with notes of grass, grapefruit, hay and herbs, and then the alcohol comes a long with a power, that makes its presence known, then the alcohol resides a bit, to leave a quite acidic grapefruity note towards the quite bitter end. Now this is a complex interpretation of a pilsner.

Keg	BrewDog	Camden	12/10/12.  A hazy blonde coloured beer with a white head and lacing.  Very hoppy but also sweet floral like notes.  Sort of toffee.  The sweetness is hard to determine but with the big hoppiness, big body and big alcohol it becomes full, complex and a bit of a struggle.  The low temperature doesnt help this either.  There may be a lavender note too.
You had me at ceramic bottle... Poured a cloudy golden colour. Smells of lemon and malty/yeasty sweetness. Good crisp hop taste following the malty sweet initial flavor.

Pours a hazy golden color with a white head. Has a very nice amount of lace with a nice yeasty and hoppy aroma. Taste up from the is a bit sweet and yeasty with some lemon and then finishes with a nice smooth pilsner taste. Extremely smooth for a 8.8 percent beer.
Keg at Brewdog, Camden, London. A hazy yellow coloured pour with a small white head on top. Malty, hoppy aroma. Tastes malty, hoppy, fruity, caramel. Pretty good.

On tap at Brewdog Camden. It pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a small soapy white head. Aroma is fruit, over-ripe mangos and peaches and some malt. Taste is similar, fruity and sweet-ish with a final boozy kick. Mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation. Overall, nice beer but probably not 100% my style.
Bottle from honest John. Color is golden yellow. Taste is light and crisp. Best pilsner Ive had to date.
Ceramic bottle.  Nice clean crisp ber.  Smells of hops and grassy notes.  Taste is ver clean and carbonated.  Some lemon notes also.  Very refreshing beer

Bottle.  Pours clear dark gold with a medium, frothy and bubbly white head, short retention with good lacing.  Aroma is meal, cereal, and Pils malt, spicy, earthy, and floral hops with peppery alcohol notes and a clean lager character.  Flavor is malt dominant with medium hops and bitterness, clean with a dry finish.  Medium body and carbonation.

On tap 4 oz. sample at Pizzeria Paradiso at DuPont Circle neighborhood in Washington, DC. Hazy, light yellow with small white head and fair lacing. Aroma of pilsener yeast, tart apples, grass, floral hops and caramel. Taste of floral hops, grass, caramel and yeast. Medium/light body and high carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy dark yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops and grass. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, grass, little sweet, little citrus, quite bitter with notes of alcohol.

Ceramic bottle.  Still to be convinced that imperial pilsners really work well as a style as they do not have the body and flavours to carry the alcohol.  A good crisp freshly hopped pilsner on a hot is fantastic, this however....
Bottle @ home. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of malt, sugar, grass, straw. Flavor is malt, straw, caramel, sugar, grass, alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation. 190812
Ceramice bottle @ Summer Gathering, Ulfborg. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are hops, grass, sugar, malt, straw and has bitter finish.

Bottle 750ml @ TFODRBSG12
Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes malt, caramel, alcohol and floral hops. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long bitter and sweet malty finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Ceremic Bottle @ FOneFan, Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2012. Hazy dark yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops and grass. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, grass, little sweet, little citrus, quite bitter with notes of alcohol.

Ceramic bottle. Pours bit hazy yellow with a medium white head. The aroma is citrus, light spices, light peach and caramel. The flavour is quite alcoholic with notes of peach, caramel and butterscotch. Way too alcoholic in the flavour to be really good.

Bottle, 75cl swingtop ceramic, at TFODRBSG-12. A lightly unclear, golden one, topped by a small, white head. Citrusy, piney nose with some pale malts. Quite bitter on the palate, dry and full-bodied, with pleasant carbonation. Citrus peel, resins and some maltyness in the flavor, leading to a mostly bitter finish. A quite pleasant one, although a bit on the bitter side. 120818
Bottle @ TFODRBSG, Ulfborg. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - flowers and grass. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 180812

Bottle, bought @ hop-head.dk. Pours murky yellow with a small, frothy, white, lacing head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light vinious, doughy, citric, grassy. Medium carbonation, nice creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has crisp malts, light yeast, vinious, oranges, citrus. Long, lingering dry and very bitter finish. Nice.

A-- Poured a clear straw yellow with a big billowy white head. Left sticky lacing all over the glass. Once settled down a solid one finger head.

S-- Floral, sweet, and biscuit like. Great smell and well balanced with the hops and the malt.

T-- Hop forward with malt in the background. Still has a floral citrus taste. Nicely done.

M-- Lots of grapefruit taste and feel. Hops are very forward but the malt really balances it well and finishes quite clean. Spot on carbonation and creamy mouthfeel.

D-- Big on flavor and alcohol becomes more noticeable as it warms up. 8.8% Really??

Ceramic bottle. Bought this one as soon as it came in at Canals. Shared with Joe. Aromas and taste of spicy hops, caramel malts, earthy grains, orange citrus, and some pepper. Very carbonated, light to med bodied. Bitter and tangy finish.

Tried this a couple of times. Leaves something to be desired. Not exceptionally well balanced for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
190712. Tap at Rogue, SF. Pours hazy golden with a medium head. Aroma bread, hops, fruits. Medium bitter sweet taste. A hint of alcohol comes through. Not Bad.
75 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear golden with a decent white head that fades leaving a little lacing. Aroma is sweet malt, grains, subdued floral hops. Taste follows the aroma quite well.

750ml ceramic swing top bottle pours golden in color with an abundant white head that settles to reveal some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is floral hops with cereal grains and light alcohol.  Taste is well balanced with intense hop bitterness and a robust grainy malt sweetness.  Medium bodied with quite a bit of carbonation leaving a pleasant sensation on the palate.  This is quite an exceptional Imperial pilsener and although quite pricey is worth a try.
Could be because it was so old that it lost its flavor. Bottle I got was so old it had accumulated dirt around the base of the cap. Low carbonation with lemon notes and a lil bit of hoppy biterness.

Draught @ Rogue Distillery and Public House, Portland
Aroma is sweetish with pineapples and it feels soapy. Flavour has alcohol, some pineapples, apricot and resin. The alcohol comes through too much, might have been better if served colder.
Ecco questa è la mia imperial pilsner preferita! Davvero magnifica e soprattutto resa ancora più amara dalla sconfitta nella finale degli europei 2012! Aparte gli scherzi magnifica!!!
On tap at the brewpub in Newport. Fruity and citrus with a sweet malty background. Light bitterness. Smooth and easy to drink. Tasty.

ceramic bottle from ølbutikken.
clear yellow, smooth yet bubbly white head.
sweet malty aroma, strong lager like, a little cereral and citrus, discrete hops, hops are floral and bitter, quite subtle.
flavor is bitter hoppy, sweet malty, flowery hoppy, sweetish eggyolk note, sort of an us style lager, not very refined or anything. a bit weird.

Slightly hazy yellow. Taste is resinous grass like a noble hop extract. High sweetness into the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured golden Orange with a light head and a slightly fruity aroma. The bitterness of the hops was a welcome change to most puke Ive tried. Finished slighty bitter with a slightly fruity taste akin to pineapple
Pretty hoppy but overall good taste. Stout but smooth. Love the bottle. Pretty pricey but good quality.
great pilsner its like a  high end hieneken. with body and puls you just gotta have that bottle.
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Not going to go into this. Its solid without being remarkable. Easy drinkability which is what I expect from imperial pilsners

An excellent and very complex pilsener.  Aroma of lemony hops, sweet malt, and some yeast.  Appearance is very hazy, but no suspended particles.  Color is hazy gold, and the head is medium in size and foamy with remnants of soapy lacing on the glass.  Taste starts off with lightly bitter hops, but finishes dry and sweet, even a little oaky.  The dry bitter hops linger on the palate.  This is an excellent beer to take to your favorite BYOB Sushi restaurant,.

Draft.  Pours a hazy golden orange with a small head and minimal lacing.  Smell is grain and some floral hops.  Taste is so much more alcoholic than the 8.8% should be.  Taste is sweet rice/grain with straight sugar crystals.  Just overly grainy and way too sweet with too much booze.  Not a beer to my liking.

tap at pap 3/10/11.

maybe hazy...i cant tell since the glasses here are filthy. rich straw color with a big soft airy white head.

lots of florals and alcohol in the nose.... along with pils, apple juice, white grape juice, grain husks, citrus and juniper. 

the palate is a touch sweet yet grainy bitter on the end. lots of alcohol is present along with the rest of the notes from the aroma. it is kinda harsh... much like a cleaner hoppier version of cheap euro lager. meh. 6/4/6/3/13

Hazy amber/orange color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, some yeast, floral hops, caramel, & citrus; Flavor of sweet malt, pine/floral hops, caramel, citrus, and spice; Finish is bitter with some alcohol; Nicely balanced; Overall, very tasty pils - cool bottle.

Appearance: Nice golden color

Smell: Floral and Hoppy

Taste: A very good balance of sweet pineapple-like taste and a ripened grapefruit bitterness.

Overall: Best pilsner hands down!  I give it 95 as a beer, 100 as a pilsner!

draft at Coles, Buffalo NY> ever slightly murky golden color, slight grass aroma with floral hop aroma, Solid flavor, definately more bitter than most pilsners. Bitterness surrounds your whole tongue. Shows the 8.8% proudly, nice pils
Color amarillo dorado.aromas florales y lupulo.sabor a malta y citricos.final amargo y envolvente.recomendable
En botella.Dorada con buena retención,aromas a trigo,pomelo...Floral en boca.Bien lúpulada con alcohol  bien escondido.

A slightly cloudy yellow body and a white foamy head.  A subtle yeasty aroma with some citrus.  The taste is a nice balance of citrus and yeasty dough, with the citrus and hops making the forward flavor and the yeast the aftertaste.  Less crisp than the usual pilsner and much more complex.
Tap -nice big foamy head, medium gold color, very complex balanced flavor - very good beer

Aroma is flowery, with some hay and grass.  Nice fresh hops scent from the dry hopping.  Color is between pale and golden, somewhat cloudy.  Medium amount of head, white and nice lace on the sides of the glass.  Overall, I really like the color and head.  The hops are very apparent.  A little sweetness and maltiness comes out in the middle.  Surprisingly full body for the style.  Creamy texture and typical carbonation.  Finish is on the bitter side.  I very much enjoyed this beer, which is more robust than the typical pilsner and hopped differently.
Golden color pour with a nice head. Aroma is cereal grain and floral hops.  Flavor is hoppy but not to the point of being bitter. Good.
chiara buona schiuma media persitenza naaso erbaceeo mieloso lieve un tocco di lievito in bocca mielosa iniziale con note erbacee luppolato piuttosto decise media secchezza

Location: Draft at Rogue San Fran, 5/12/11


Aroma: The nose is hop, grass, cereal, and pale malts

Appearance: The pour is a hazy golden-amber color

Flavor: The taste is similar to the nose, cereal and hops

Palate: The body is light-medium, somewhat chewy, and a touch of heat

Overall Impression: 
This was a solid beer overall.  It is definately an interesting interpretation of a pilsner.

big ceramic bottle at Morimotos sushi restaurant at Boca Raton resort.  pours amber-golden in colour, with thin white head.  aroma and taste are big, both huge bitter, resiny hops, and tonnes of caramel malt.  alcohol shows through here.  this is a big beer!
Draught at Waldo Pizza.  Pours a pale yellow.  Aroma of lemon, dust, straw, berries.  Flavor is sweet tarts, grass, berries.  Interesting, but just isnt cohesive with my taste buds.  Okay at best.

Tap @ Waldos KC. Somewhat hazy, golden yellow appearance with a fluffy white head. Moderately noble, floral hoppy, slightly grainy, slightly fruity, pale pils malty nose. Creamy, moderately fruity (almost like passionfruit), noble, floral hoppy, highly pale pils malty, lager flavor. Noble hoppy aftertaste. Pretty good.

Late kudos from memory. Bottle @ Morimoto in NYC. Great for an imp pilsner. Prably saaz and sorachi, indeed. Floral, bready with a funky pungent quality. Quite complex, both in aroma and taste, with a nice lingering bitterness. Light was poor, but seemed light amber and with a decent head. One of the best looking bottles Ive ever seen. The waitress asked if we wanted to bring it with us once I was done with the beer - apparently a quite common request...

On tap at Map Room Chicago. Pours a nice bright golden with a creamy white head. Aroma of noble hops, saaz it seemed. Very fragrant, herbal and floral along with a nice fruitiness, mostly lemon and light bready maltiness. Flavor really compounds well on the noble hop and lemon zestiness. Really nice character along with just a touch of doughiness and the citric sits nicely before a soft fruity finish, with just the right amount of spicy bite from the hops. Medium body and a crisp carbonation. Very good beer

Glad I never splurged for the bottle and finally got to try some on draft.  Great aroma, bit fruity, very floral.  Flavor follows, almost seems like theres a lemony sorachi ace thing going on here with this vintage, lightly cheesy, saaz is my guess here, slightly oddly fruity at first but its really a fantastic strong pils once that goes away after a sip or two.

Sold as "XS Pilsner". Slightly hazy yellow color, small white head. Sweet malty, grassy aroma. Medium-bodied. Fruity (green apple), brutal alcoholic flavor. Lingering alcoholic, harsh aftertaste. Rogues malt liquer.

Funky grain nose, with strong hay overtones. Cloudy amber, medium head, nice lacing. Overripe lemons, oranges, and grain flavor. Sweet malt at midpalate. Finishes with a sharp grassy bitterness. Quite good for a style I dont like.

Pours a pale yellow colour, clears with a small frothy white head. Aroma is of floral hops and pale grain malts. Taste is a little sweet initially and then becomes very bitter, even more so than a typical pilsner. Light-medium body, average carbonation, thin but smooth mouth feel.

Bottle split with mcberko. Pours a cloudy amber yellow. Aroma is floral with some sweetness, grass and citrus fruits. Flavour is again floral, honey, citrus, grapefruit, grass. Lots of flavours. Pleasantly bitter finish and complex. ABV hidden.

750mL ceramic bottle, split with Matts_Property, pours hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aroma of pilsner hops, earth and herbal / funky notes. Flavour is very floral with sweet malts and deliciously bitter hops. Extremely dense, full flavour. ABV is extremely well hidden. Delicious.
Cloudy straw yellow color with a soapy white head.  Aroma of grain, hops and grass.  Bitter flavor with hops, grain, with a touch of sweetness.  Very nice beer!  Great lacing.

Pour yellow golden straw not really much head at all but what was there was white head with surprising lace effects. Aroma quite malty, fruity, biscuit, floral and grassy. Taste wow I was quite surprised very nice balance sweet pils malt with grassy hops, biscuit and cereal like grain. MF is super solid medium easy to drink with a nice carb. Very good stuff however overly expensive the bottle artwork is incredible.

Tap at the Astoria brewpub location. Light gold pour with a thin white head. Smooth malt taste, touches of sweetness, bread and a hoppy bite. Musty hops, lots of citrus and touches bread in the aroma. Good stuff.
Draft at RnH with Linh. Pours a light hazy golden body with no head, some minor lacing. Aroma/flavor is bitter, almost skunky floral hops.

I was surprised by this beer.  Im not a pilsner guy, but this was highly recommended.  From the tap.  Pours golden with a dry hopped (cascade?) nose.  Thin mouthfeel.  Starts like a pilsner, finishes like an IPA, with a hoppy finish that is uncharacteristic of a pilsner but is necessary because of the ABV.  I really enjoyed this brew.
Draft at rnh. Gold hazy color. Smells of sugar and powser. Tastye is creamy, malty and boozy. Awesome imp pilsner interrpretation

pours a hazy golden yellow.  Aroma reveals pilsner malts and earthy floral hops.  Taste is sweet with a nice bitter finish.  Residual sweetness reigns supreme in the struggle between malts and hops.  Very smooth mouth feel.  Overall what makes this good is the masking of the higher alcohol content.  At no point did I feel that I could only drink one of these.

Pours very rough from the re-sealable clay bottle. Causes the strong floral aroma to really permeate the surrounding air. A dense, long lasting, creamy white head is also created from the rough pour. A deep golden color brew is present in the glass with a slight chill haze present. The nose has a sstrong floral hops kick followed by a strong graininess that also incorporates a low caramel toastedness as well as slight cream ale light finish. Flavor starts off with a mild grassy presence, lots of sweet flowery tastes follow with a mild graininess at the end. Alcohol doesnt seem to be a  dominate factor in this brew. Body is modest but the low carbonation was a bit disappointing as a typical pils normally has a great sharp carbonation to it. Overall a pretty pleasant brew. My only knock on it would be the carbonation but this was on the discount rack so who knows how long it was there. Nice to see a swing cap on an imperial ale so I could save some for later during dinner or after word.
UPDATED: SEP 20, 2014 Very effervescent alcohol aroma and flavor.  Hoppy in ways most pilsners are not, pretty good beer but way too expensive to drink all the time.

Clear golden in the glass with a thick white head.  Fantastic noble hop aroma with spice and floral notes.  Potent bitterness on the palate but still maintains a fairly light mouthfeel.  A really excellent beer.
This was the first double pilsner I have ever tasted.  It was very similar to a normal pilsner only you can taste much more hoppy bitterness.

Draught at OT October-10
Golden with a white head.
Malty and fruity in both aroma and flavour.
Flowery hoppiness.
On tap at sergios.  Pours light golden with a vwhite head. Strong hops aroma/flavor for a pilsner.  Very bitter.  A really good beer

Draught at Tadgs. Grainy, malty aroma with big cereals and noble hops. Nice, cloudy deep gold color. Big honey malt flavor, lemon, citrus, huge hops, nice cereal grains. Strong bitterness that is off-putting at first but which then becomes quite nice. Big, full body. A surprising and fun beer.

Aroma is sweet malts, bready malts, some fruity and grassy notes along with some slight notes of grains and alcohol. Flavour is quite similar, but lacks the grainyness. A quite biting, but pleasant, Imperial Pils.

On tap at the Petrol Station in Houston. Gold/straw yellow, a little hazy, with a small white head and some light lacing. The nose is lightly sweet and a little grainy, along with floral/citrus hops. Flavor is strongly hoppy - citrus/grapefruit in tone - and somewhat dry, with a light amount of crystal malt in the background.
